image.altText: A 25-year-old woman with brown shoulder-length hair, in a fancy red top, staring into a mirror

props.synopsis: Funding pressures have forced the 52-year-old Canberra Youth Theatre to suspend its artistic program for 2025. The theatre has produced many film and theatre professionals, including Bump star Nathalie Morris.

title.children: Youth theatre program that launched Australian star's career suspended

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: Police allege the 39-year-old man's offences took place between 2002 and 2020, and impacted 11 victims.

title.children: Man facing 136 family violence charges against 11 victims, including incest

image.altText: Tara Cheyne with red hair and a floral dress speaking.

props.synopsis: Laws designed to assist victim-survivors of domestic violence in leaving abusive situations by breaking a lease take effect in the ACT today.

title.children: 'No-one should be forced to stay': Help for victim-survivors to break leases

image.altText: Blue and white police tape in front of traffic accident scene

props.synopsis: A man has died in NSW after being hit in the head by an object that came loose from a caravan travelling in the other direction.

title.children: Driver dies after being struck by object falling from passing caravan near Yass

image.altText: Two men, one of them shirtless, smile with their arms around each other at an indoor pool.

props.synopsis: For the past seven years, Peter Thorn has thrived under his National Disability Insurance Scheme plan — until earlier this year, when he was told there had been an "error" and his seven days of overnight support per week were cut to just seven days a year.

title.children: Funding woes and program cuts devastate NDIS providers in the ACT

image.altText: A yellow bus with smoke billowing out the top and flames on an inner city street.

props.synopsis: Bus driver Gary Reeves swiftly evacuated 33 school children off a school bus before it burst into flames on a Kiama street. Leaders have shared their pride in his actions by giving him a 'community hero' award.

title.children: 'Hero' South Coast bus driver credits student's keen sense of smell for fire rescue

image.altText: ABC News Breakfast - James Glenday & Bridget Brennan

props.synopsis: Glenday replaces Michael Rowland, who is leaving News Breakfast after 15 years. Catherine Murphy will take over from Tony Armstrong as News Breakfast  sports presenter.

title.children: James Glenday to replace Michael Rowland as News Breakfast co-host in 2025

image.altText: A bald man in a black suit and white button down shirt without a tie looks serious.

props.synopsis: Newly-elected MLA Thomas Emerson caused some furore when he turned up to day one of the ACT's Legislative Assembly sans-tie, with the speaker warning of a "dramatic decline" of dress standards. But is it time to get with the times, and ditch the tie altogether?

title.children: The pandemic sparked a shift to more casual clothing but should that apply to politics?

image.altText: Burnt shelves are seen against a wall inside the synagogue after the arson attack.

props.synopsis: After it was declared a "likely terrorist incident", Australia's key security agencies are being brought together to investigate the arson attack on the Adass Israel Synagogue in Melbourne.

title.children: What we know about the synagogue terror attack investigation

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: Close to 200,000 households are either already breaching their mortgage contracts, or risk doing so, as the surging cost of home insurance forces many to dump their policies.

title.children: Nearly 200,000 households are at risk of breaching their home loans

image.altText: A close up shot of Rupert Murdoch wearing a suit and glasses. He is obscuring a man who is standing behind him.

props.synopsis: A US court has ruled against Rupert Murdoch's bid to change his family trust to consolidate control of his media empire in the hands of his son Lachlan, the New York Times reports, citing a sealed court document.

title.children: Rupert Murdoch fails in bid to change family trust, NYT reports

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese in a suit.

props.synopsis: The taskforce, belatedly created by the Albanese government after Friday's arson attack on a synagogue in Melbourne, follows more than a year of what one senior Jewish community leader condemns as "paralysis by indecision".

title.children: Albanese rejects blame for rise in anti-Semitism

image.altText: A doctor sitting behind a desk. Subtitles say 'Do you honestly think metformin is the answer by now?'

props.synopsis: Online scammers are exploiting the faces and names of real Australian doctors to sell dietary supplements and peddle harmful medical advice, putting patients' health at risk.

title.children: Melbourne doctor finds himself at centre of deepfake scam

image.altText: A composite image of Ted O'Brien and Chris Bowen.

props.synopsis: The debate over Australia's energy future took place on 7.30 with Ted O'Brien making "assurances" for the opposition when it came to costings.

title.children: 'Deeply offensive': Bowen rebukes Dutton over CSIRO comments

image.altText: People on platform and at the departures board at Sydney's Central train station

props.synopsis: It's the RBA's latest buzzword for justifying why interest rates need to remain at restrictive levels. But while everyone agrees we have a productivity problem, solving it is another challenge entirely.

title.children: If our productivity levels stay low, the RBA will keep rates high

image.altText: A group of people gathered outside a lit-up white weatherboard house at night.

props.synopsis: In the hours before Suzy Wood died she heard one last song from a choir gathered outside her home. In the days afterwards, it emerged that it wasn't the first time magic had struck at number 27.

title.children: 120 years apart, two identical acts of love played out at this address

image.altText: Business people walk past a shiny black sign that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: The RBA's final meeting for 2024 is today, but it's widely expected interest rates will remain on hold until next year. Meanwhile, the Australian share market is trading lower. Follow live.

title.children: RBA unlikely to cut interest rates at final meeting of the year, ASX lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: NAB business survey: business confidence and conditions both deteriorated in November
What time is the RBA decision today?
Does our tight labour market mean the RBA should maintain interest rates? No, says top labour expert

image.altText: Woman with black hair with face blurred outside looks out green fence

props.synopsis: Kayla, whose name has been changed, is one of four transgender women transferred interstate into a New South Wales immigration detention facility this year.

title.children: Transgender woman in detention feels trapped in 'horrific' conditions

image.altText: A person on a boat wearing a safety vest, high vis clothing and a helmet uses binoculars to monitor a ship.

props.synopsis: The spotting of Chinese warships near Taiwan follows President Lai Ching-te's tour of the Pacific, including the US state of Hawaii, which has angered Beijing.

title.children: Taiwan's military on high alert as Chinese warships sail near island

image.altText: A young woman sits smiling at a desktop computer

props.synopsis: These days, just about everything is being done online. But new research highlights how hard that's making life for thousands of Australians still living without phone and internet.

title.children: Remote Aboriginal communities left offline in digital age shift

image.altText: Cate Blanchett in low light, very close up, staring right at the camera, looking frightened

props.synopsis: The nominees have been announced with Australians on the list, while Emilia Pérez and Wicked both received multiple nominations.

title.children: Blanchett and Kidman among Australians nominated for Golden Globes

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman looking serious.

props.synopsis: The family of an Indigenous woman killed in a hit-and-run in Darwin have spoken out after the man who struck her and tried to cover it up, leaving her disembodied leg on the highway, was released from prison on appeal.

title.children: Hit-run victim's family 'disgusted' after killer released from prison

image.altText: A court sketch of a man holding a cloth, half covering his face

props.synopsis: A repeat violent offender with 'one of the worst' records seen by a Supreme Court judge will be released from prison in two days; despite admitting he may not be able to comply with a supervision order.

title.children: Violent offender repeatedly asks if he can 'stay in jail' during hearing ahead of release

image.altText: A woman standing away from a ferris wheel

props.synopsis: Mandy* used to relish going out to see live music, but that joy was taken away from her when someone spiked her drink with opiates earlier this year.

title.children: Spiked with opiates in her mid-40s, Mandy is reluctant to ever go out again

image.altText: Wide shot at a farm, rows of bright coloured basil stretching to the horizon

props.synopsis: It has been a perfect season for herb growers, with production doubling on some farms, but a wholesaler says consumers are increasingly choosing the dried product.

title.children: Australia faces an oversupply of fresh herbs as demand stagnates

image.altText: Kamilaroi goaler and returning Black Swans representative Olivia Clark.

props.synopsis: A 20-strong squad of athletes has been named to represent the Black Swans, the First Nations national team, as part of initiatives by Netball Australia to increase representation throughout the sport.

title.children: 'Been a place of trauma': First Nations squad to help rectify wrongs of netball's past

image.altText: Laitia Moceidreke of the Cowboys running with the football in both hands

props.synopsis: One-time North Queensland NRL winger Laitia Moceidreke will attempt to follow in Jordan Mailata's footsteps, after quitting rugby league to try his hand in the NFL.

title.children: NRL convert among Australia's latest NFL hopefuls

image.altText: Narrow corridor lined with light timber beams, with a walking person just visible at the end.

props.synopsis: In the throes of a climate and cost-of-living crisis, Breathe Architecture founder Jeremy McLeod says it's time for Australia to rethink its unsustainable housing design "failure". His latest work, on show now at NGV International, shows exactly how we might go about it.

title.children: Australia's huge houses show 'failure of a city' but there's an elegant solution

image.altText: The hands of a child drawing with coloured pencils.

props.synopsis: A review into the safety of homeschooling in Queensland has found 35 cases of children living in high-risk environments.

title.children: Homeschooling review after child's death leads to calls for more oversight

image.altText: A man in a shirt and tie smiling.

props.synopsis: Two years after removing Nick Goiran from the shadow cabinet over leaked WhatsApp messages, WA Liberal leader Libby Mettam re-appoints him — but is is a shrewd political move or a deal to save her leadership? State political reporter Keane Bourke reports.

title.children: Savvy or desperate? WA Liberals welcome Nick Goiran back into fold after 'Clan' exile

image.altText: Wallaroos players standing arm in arm during the national anthem

props.synopsis: The Wallaroos have a busy international campaign scheduled as they build into next year's Women's Rugby World Cup in England.

title.children: Wallaroos to play seven Tests to prepare for World Cup

image.altText: camwmb_LakeBolac_2511_00-15-00.07

props.synopsis: A social media post has helped a small school in western Victoria find a science teacher, as the sector struggles to attract staff and more than 1,000 teaching positions sit vacant across the state.

title.children: Country school gets creative to attract new teacher after a year-long search

image.altText: A black and white portrait photo of a man looking serious with a moustache.

props.synopsis: The New South Wales government says the artwork infamous murderer Leonard Lawson did on the old walls of Grafton Gaol must go before the site becomes part of a new hospital because it could be upsetting for staff.

title.children: Plan to cover up comic book killer's 'triggering' artwork dismays historians

image.altText: Children and staff are seen around a rug while playing at a child care centre

props.synopsis: As the Queensland government debates laws to make the state safer, an Australian study spanning more than 20 years finds early preschool interventions can ensure children live a life without crime.

title.children: Preschool intervention dramatically reduces youth crime, study finds

image.altText: Female minister sitting down, with walker in front of her, in front of Uniting Church sign.

props.synopsis: As a reverend with cerebral palsy, I’m not the minister most congregants expect. I’ve dropped Eucharist wine and stuttered through sermons. But I have something unique to offer.

title.children: The reverend who's redefining what church leaders look like
